channel.title: How do i compile with windows 7?
channel.description: Has anyone out there with windows 7 found a way to compile yet? im using a compile ive always used on windows xp. Ive downloaded jre and jdk, and also set the enviornmental variables too. But it says it cant find the path specified... can anyone help me?

item.title: How do i compile with windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @Czar_y2k Czar y2k
item.description:
@Czar_y2k wrote:

deathschaos9:

You have a 64 bit OS dont you?

read above message, and yeah i do.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i compile with windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @Czar_y2k Czar y2k
item.description:
@Czar_y2k wrote:

ok for some reason says the request isnt allowed. how do i fix it? (ignore)

ok nvm i got it to work, but now the compiler says
Javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: Javac
use- help for a list of options

Read full topic
item.source: How do i compile with windows 7?

item.title: How do i compile with windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Czar y2k:

ok now i get that javac isnt recognized as internel or external command

Which means that you havent set your environmental variables correctly.

This will help you.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i compile with windows 7?

item.title: How do i compile with windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @Czar_y2k Czar y2k
item.description:
@Czar_y2k wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:6, topic:323663”][quote author=k0 twin link=topic=420070.msg3085804#msg3085804 date=1262480524]
Just use this

@echo off @title Compiler javac *java pause
[/quote]

You didn’t add the ‘.’ between the star and ‘java’.

@Czar y2k:

Use:

@echo off javac *.java pause

It also depends if your server is packaged or not. If it is, then you’ll have to change the path to wherever the Java files are.[/quote]

ok now i get that javac isnt recognized as internel or external command

Read full topic
item.source: How do i compile with windows 7?

item.title: How do i compile with windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“k0 twin, post:4, topic:323663”]Just use this

@echo off @title Compiler javac *java pause[/quote]

You didn’t add the ‘.’ between the star and ‘java’.

@Czar y2k:

Use:

@echo off javac *.java pause

It also depends if your server is packaged or not. If it is, then you’ll have to change the path to wherever the Java files are.

Read full topic

item.source: How do i compile with windows 7?

item.title: How do i compile with windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @dy3p8ntrkid dy3p8ntrkid
item.description:
@dy3p8ntrkid wrote:

I use windows 7 with a 508 and 525 server, my compilers look like this.

Palidino76 Base [508]

@echo off title compile cd ../src echo Compiling "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../build/ ./net/com/Engine.java pause

Codeusa Base [525]

@echo off title Compiling ReQuiem525 cd ../src echo Compiling net/com/codeusa/Engine.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../build/ ./net/com/codeusa/Engine.java pause

It should be the same setup if you’re using XP, it’s not much different.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i compile with windows 7?
